page.title: 12By the Canal,Wolverhampton
page.content: I used to play by the canal and occasionally helped with the locks;but I never crossed over by the locks,I crossed over by the bridges. The canal is about six feet wide and very deep so I had to be careful. Sometimes I sat down in the plants and watched the narrow boats go by and waved to the people on them. Some people say the canal is polluted and that no fish live in it;but although it is murky,I've seen little sticklebacks and newts. It is a nice place to walk along;there are attractive plants and lots of different kinds of wildlife. Along the banks are buildings which are used for different things. There is a Sea Scout base,a caravan and boat dealer,a coal merchant and in one place,a few feet away from the canal,is a school. I stopped playing there because the plants grew over the path and it became dangerous.
